format-content-net.meta_title: .NET {{FILEFORMAT}} Viewer API - read, view, render in C# VB.NET
format-content-net.meta_description: .NET document viewer API to read, render and display {{FILEFORMAT}} in any type of C#, ASP.NET, VB.NET & .NET Core applications.
format-content-net.title: {{FILEFORMAT}} file viewer for C# .NET applications
format-content-net.description: .NET document viewer API to read, render and display {{FILEFORMAT}} file in any type of C#, ASP.NET, VB.NET & .NET Core applications. View the rendered files with true formatting & layout in HTML5, PDF or as an image using a few lines of the code.
format-content-net.subtitle: Document rendering solution
format-content-net.about_content: Start viewing 190+ popular document formats in your .NET applications using GroupDocs.Viewer for .NET APIs by adding a few lines of code. Developers can easily display PDF, Word Processing, Excel Spreadsheet, Presentation, Visio, Project, Outlook and many other popular document formats in HTML5, image or PDF modes. The document rendering is fast, identical to the original source file, and it does not require installing additional software or any other external libraries.
format-content-net.steps_content: With GroupDocs.Viewer you can render {{FILEFORMAT}} to HTML, JPEG, PNG or PDF in a few steps.
format-content-net.steps_content_step_1: Install GroupDocs.Viewer for .NET using your favorite package manager.
format-content-net.steps_content_step_2: Create an instance of Viewer class and load the {{FILEFORMAT}} file with full path.
format-content-net.steps_content_step_3: Set options to render {{FILEFORMAT}} file into HTML, PNG, JPEG or PDF format.
format-content-net.steps_content_step_4: Render file and check output in the current directory.
format-content-net.steps_code_comment_4: Render {{FILEFORMAT}} file to HTML with embedded resources
format-content-net.actions_description: Try GroupDocs.Viewer features for free or request a license
format-content-net.more_formats_description: Multi-format documents and images viewer API for .NET. View some of the popular file formats below without any external viewers.

format-content-java.meta_title: Java {{FILEFORMAT}} Viewer API - render & display {{FILEFORMAT}} in Java apps
format-content-java.meta_description: View {{FILEFORMAT}} files in Java, J2EE, J2SE applications. Supports viewing 180+ document and image file formats in HTML, PDF or image mode with advanced features to manage document viewing options.
format-content-java.title: Render & view {{FILEFORMAT}} in Java
format-content-java.description: Native and high performance {{FILEFORMAT}} file viewer API for Java, J2EE and J2SE based applications, supporting a wide range of additional features to customize the appearance of the output document format.
format-content-java.subtitle: Document rendering solution
format-content-java.about_content: Enable your Java applications to display over 180+ file formats in HTML, PDF or image modes using GroupDocs.Viewer for Java APIs without any additional software installed; such as Microsoft Office, Apache Open Office, Adobe Acrobat Reader etc. Developers can easily view all popular images and document types including Microsoft Office, OpenDocument, HTML, PDF, Archive, Diagrams, Photoshop, AutoCAD and programming language formats inside the Java applications with fast and highest quality rendering.
format-content-java.steps_content: With GroupDocs.Viewer you can render {{FILEFORMAT}} to HTML, JPEG, PNG or PDF in a few steps.
format-content-java.steps_content_step_1: Add GroupDocs.Viewer for Java as a dependency to your project.
format-content-java.steps_content_step_2: Create an instance of Viewer class and load the {{FILEFORMAT}} file with full path.
format-content-java.steps_content_step_3: Set options to render {{FILEFORMAT}} file into HTML, PNG, JPEG or PDF format.
format-content-java.steps_content_step_4: Render file and check output in the current directory.
format-content-java.steps_code_comment_4: Render {{FILEFORMAT}} file to HTML with embedded resources
